content.text:
# List of amphibious warfare ships of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary

This is a list of amphibious warfare ships of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary, the naval auxiliary fleet of the United Kingdom.
Active
There are two types of amphibious warfare ships currently in service with the RFA as of 2024, totalling four vessels: One littoral strike ship  and three s.
The three Bay class ships are projected to be removed from service by 2032.

Decommissioned
Dock landing ships
Bay-class dock landing ship
In service with the Royal Fleet Auxiliary between 2006 and 2011, she was sold to the Royal Australian Navy.
*
Landing ship logistics
Round table class
The Round Table-class landing ship logistics were a class of six ships, all of which would be named after Knights of the Round Table.
*
*  (L3005)
*
*
*  (as of 2024, used as static special forces training vessel)
*  (L3005)
*
Chartered Landing Ship Logistics
After the loss of  RFA Sir Galahad and the damage to RFA Sir Tristam during the Falklands War, two commercial Roll-on/roll-off ferries were temporarily chartered.
*
*
Strategic Sealift
Strategic Sealift Ro/Ro
Two commercial Ro/Ro vessels bareboat chartered for additional freight carrying capacity with formation of the Joint Rapid Deployment Force (JRDF).
*
*
Landing Ship Tank
Originally operated by the Royal Navy, in 1956 she was transferred to civilian administration as SS Empire Gull. She joined the RFA in 1970 and was in service until 1978, being the only Landing Ship Tank operated as an Royal Fleet Auxiliary.
*
Landing Ship Gantry
Dale class
Three Dale-class tankers were converted into Landing Ship Gantry’s and were then reconverted back into tankers at the end of the Second World War.
*
*
*
